category.title: Chapter 1 & 2 Wildcard
category.question:
What does "dorsal" refer to in anatomical directions? B. Back of the body
A. Front of the body B. Back of the body C. Top of the body D. Bottom of the body

Which body cavity contains the brain? C. Cranial cavity
A. Thoracic cavity B. Abdominal cavity C. Cranial cavity D. Ventral cavity

Which plane divides the body into anterior and posterior sections? B. Coronal plane
A. Transverse plane B. Coronal plane C. Sagittal plane D. Oblique plane

What does "inferior" refer to in anatomical directions? C. Below or lower
A. Toward the back B. Toward the front C. Below or lower D. Toward the side
This body cavity contains the heart and lungs. (Answer: Thoracic cavity) Thoracic cavity
The term used to describe the position of the wrist relative to the elbow is ___. (Answer: Distal) Distal

category.title: Chapter 4 Review
category.question:
Which type of epithelial tissue forms the outer layer of the skin? C. Stratified squamous
A. Simple squamous B. Simple cuboidal C. Stratified squamous D. Transitional

What is the main function of connective tissue? B. Support and bind other tissues
A. Conduct nerve impulses B. Support and bind other tissues C. Absorb nutrients D. Contract for movement

Nervous tissue consists of neurons and this type of supporting cell. B. Glial cells
A. Chondrocytes B. Glial cells C. Osteocytes D. Adipocytes

What type of tissue is responsible for contractions and movement? C. Muscle tissue
A. Nervous tissue B. Epithelial tissue C. Muscle tissue D. Connective tissue
This structure in a neuron receives incoming signals and directs them toward the cell body. (Answer: Dendrites) Dendrites
The extracellular matrix of connective tissue contains fibers like collagen, reticular, and ___. (Answer: Elastic fibers) Elastic fibers

category.title: Functions of the Integumentary System
category.question:
Which skin function is primarily responsible for preventing dehydration? D. Protection
A. Vitamin D production B. Excretion C. Sensation D. Protection

Which of the following functions involves regulating body temperature? A. Sweating
A. Sweating B. Protection C. Melanin production D. Vitamin D production

What role does the skin play in the production of Vitamin D? A. Produces vitamin D upon exposure to sunlight
A. Produces vitamin D upon exposure to sunlight B. Absorbs vitamin D from the diet C. Stores vitamin D in the epidermis D. Transfers vitamin D from the liver to the skin

What is the function of sweat glands in the skin? B. Regulate body temperature through evaporation
A. Produce oil to lubricate skin B. Regulate body temperature through evaporation C. Secrete hormones D. Protect from UV light
The skin regulates body temperature through two key processes: dilation/constriction of blood vessels and the production of this liquid by glands. (Answer: Sweat) Sweat
The skin aids in waste excretion by eliminating small amounts of ___ through sweat. (Answer: Urea) Urea

category.title: Layers of the Skin
category.question:
Which layer of skin contains melanocytes, the cells responsible for skin color? B. Stratum basale
A. Stratum corneum B. Stratum basale C. Dermis D. Subcutaneous tissue

What is the outermost layer of the epidermis called? D. Stratum corneum
A. Stratum basale B. Stratum granulosum C. Stratum spinosum D. Stratum corneum

What is the function of the stratum corneum? A. Provide a tough, waterproof barrier
A. Provide a tough, waterproof barrier B. House sensory receptors C. Store melanin D. Contain hair follicles

Which layer of the dermis contains collagen and elastic fibers, providing strength and flexibility to the skin? D. Reticular layer
A. Papillary layer B. Epidermal layer C. Subcutaneous layer D. Reticular layer
Name the layer of skin that helps anchor it to underlying structures and provides insulation. (Answer: Subcutaneous tissue) Subcutaneous tissue
This layer of the epidermis contains dead keratinized cells. (Answer: Stratum corneum) Stratum corneum

category.title: Accessory Structures & Skin Color/Protection
category.question: This protein in the epidermis provides a tough, waterproof barrier to the skin. Keratin
What is the primary pigment responsible for skin color? Melanin
Sebaceous glands secrete this substance to keep hair and skin moisturized. Sebum
Collagen is abundant in this layer of the dermis, providing the skin its strength. Reticular layer
This gene is responsible for producing collagen-7, which is essential for skin integrity. (Answer: COL7A1 gene) COL7A1 gene
Arrector pili muscles contract to produce this effect on the skin when cold or scared. (Answer: Goosebumps) Goosebumps
